links.title: Snapshot isolation - Wikipedia
links.description: In databases, and transaction processing (transaction management), snapshot isolation is a guarantee that all reads made in a transaction will see a consistent snapshot of the database (in practice it reads the last committed values that existed at the time it started), and the transaction itself will successfully commit only if no updates it has made conflict with any concurrent updates made since that snapshot.

links.title: Rope (data structure) - Wikipedia
links.description: In computer programming, a rope, or cord, is a data structure composed of smaller strings that is used to efficiently store and manipulate a very long string. For example, a text editing program may use a rope to represent the text being edited, so that operations such as insertion, deletion, and random access can be done efficiently.[1]

links.title: Code Staging in GNU Guix
links.description: GNU Guix is a “functional” package manager that builds upon earlier work on Nix.  Guix implements high-level abstractions such as packages and operating system services as domain-specic languages (DSLs) embedded in Scheme.  It also implements build actions and operating system orchestration in Scheme.  This leads to a multi-tier programming environment where embedded code snippets are staged for eventual execution. links.title: SUPPLÉMENT PARTENAIRE - Les clés de demain : « Un geek est avant tout un passionné »
links.description: Jean-Baptiste Gartner est leader technique au sein d’IBM Interactive Experience et de l’IBM Studios Paris. Alors qu’il se définit lui-même comme un geek, il revient pour Les Clés de demain sur l’évolution de ce profil ces dernières années et l’intérêt qu’il représente aujourd’hui pour les entreprises techs.

links.title: NixOS Linux
links.description:
NixOS is a Linux distribution with a unique approach
  to package and configuration management.  Built on top of the Nix package manager, it is completely
  declarative, makes upgrading systems reliable, and has many other advantages.

links.description: Habitat - Automation that travels with the app. Habitat allows any app to be independent of any particular infrastructure environment, like containers or PaaS.

links.title: Nix: The Purely Functional Package Manager
links.description:
Nix is a powerful package manager for Linux and
  other Unix systems that makes package management reliable and
  reproducible. It provides atomic upgrades and rollbacks,
  side-by-side installation of multiple versions of a package,
  multi-user package management and easy setup of build
  environments. Read moreâ¦

links.title: Debian -- Details of package nvidia-driver in sid
links.description:
This metapackage depends on the NVIDIA binary driver and libraries
that provide optimized hardware acceleration of
OpenGL/GLX/EGL/GLES/Vulkan applications via a direct-rendering X Server.

Please see the nvidia-kernel-dkms or
nvidia-kernel-source packages
for building the kernel module required by this package.
This will provide nvidia-kernel-418.56.

This version only supports GeForce, Quadro, NVS, Tesla, ... GPUs based on the
Kepler, Maxwell, ...

links.title: A High-Throughput Platform to Identify Small-Molecule Inhibitors of CRISPR-Cas9
links.description:
A suite of high-throughput assays enables discovery of small-molecule inhibitors of
CRISPR-Cas9 that are cell permeable, and non-toxic, providing a chemical means to
control SpCas9-based tools.
links.original_title: A High-Throughput Platform to Identify Small-Molecule Inhibitors of Crispr-Cas9

links.title:
Robert Sweeney on LinkedIn: "I turned down Daniel Buchmueller for a job at Netflix. After a 60 minute interview I was on the fence, so I concluded that he "wasn't senior enough." He went to Amazon instead where he co-founded Amazon Prime Air (their drone delivery service) and was #2 on Fast Company's "Most Creative People" list.

At some point, we programmers are going to have to admit that we really can't judge another programmers technical abilities in a 60 min interview. We end up hiring programmers that are good at interviewing, but not necessarily good at doing the job. And we miss out on engineers like Daniel.

#hiring #softwareengineer #programmers #interviews"
links.description: April 29, 2019: Robert Sweeney posted on LinkedIn
links.original_title: “we have to admit that we can't judge a programmer in a 60 min interview”

links.description: In trademark law, confusing similarity is a test used during the examination process to determine whether a trademark conflicts with another, earlier mark, and also in trademark infringement proceedings to determine whether the use of a mark infringes a registered trademark.

links.title: Don't Waste Time On User Onboarding
links.description: There are oodles of articles about what tools to use for user onboarding, what your user onboarding UI should looks like, and exactly how to craft the perfect user onboarding experience. They're not bad advice, not exactly, but for a great many SaaS startups, they're a waste of valuable time.

links.title: Tips: Vulnerability - Daniel Coyle
links.description:
Problem: Your Group Lacks Trust

Remedy: Get Vulnerable and Stay Vulnerable

 	

Make Sure the Leader Is Vulnerable First and Often
Group cooperation is created by small, frequently repeated moments of vulnerability. Of these, none is more powerful than the moment when a leader signals their vulnerability. As one Navy SEALs commander puts it, I screwed that up  … Continue reading "Tips: Vulnerability"

links.title: The power of vulnerability
links.description: Brené Brown studies human connection -- our ability to empathize, belong, love. In a poignant, funny talk, she shares a deep insight from her research, one that sent her on a personal quest to know herself as well as to understand humanity. A talk to share.
